With only three days until Dave pops the question, the trio embark on a desperate road trip across America to sabotage his romantic plans. Family comedy sequel, starring Jason Lee and Kimberly Williams-Paisley(n)

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: A teenager from Boston moves to a small conservative town, and discovers the council and a preacher have enforced a ban on loud music and dancing. He openly defies the harsh rules, revitalising the local youth and winning the heart of the reverend's daughter. Musical remake, with Kenny Wormald, Julianne Hough and Dennis Quaid(n)

programme.title: Beethoven
programme.desc: An all-American family adopts a huge St Bernard, but the father is dismayed when it turns into a one-dog disaster zone. He insists the mutt must go to a new home, but when it is kidnapped by a crooked vet, dad has a change of heart and races to the rescue. Comedy, starring Charles Grodin, Bonnie Hunt, Oliver Platt and David Duchovny(n)

programme.title: Black Rain
programme.desc: Two New York cops arrest a hitman working for the Japanese Mafia, and are ordered to extradite him back to Osaka to stand trial. However, the prisoner gives them the slip on arrival, and as the detectives hunt him down with the aid of local law enforcement officers they become snared in a vicious gang war. Ridley Scott's thriller, starring Michael Douglas, Andy Garcia, Ken Takakura and Yasaku Matsuda

programme.title: True Deception
programme.desc: An author struggling with writer's block and drug addiction becomes fascinated with a high-profile murder trial, especially when a friend of the defendant confesses to murders he probably did not commit. He is determined to find out why he would do such a thing, finding parallels with his own father. Drama based on Stephen Elliot's novel The Adderall Diaries, starring James Franco, Ed Harris, Amber Heard and Christian Slater

programme.title: Loss of Faith
programme.desc: A crime writer is drawn into intrigue and danger while investigating the kidnapping of a baby boy and the murder of the child's wealthy father. Mystery thriller, starring John Ritter, Michele Scarabelli, Daphne Zuniga and Roddy McDowall

programme.title: Camino
programme.desc: A photographer ventures deep into the jungles of Colombia to document a group of missionaries. However, when she witnesses the leader of the group committing a horrific crime, she faces a battle for survival to make it back to civilisation with the evidence before his followers have her killed. Action thriller, starring Zoe Bell and Nacho Vigalondo

programme.title: Anti-Social
programme.desc: Crime drama, following the criminal exploits of anarchic street artist Dee and his violent gang member and jewel thief brother Marcus, who live on a London council estate. Starring Gregg Sulkin and Josh Myers

programme.title: Collateral Damage
programme.desc: A heroic firefighter is plunged into the world of international terrorism when his wife and child are killed in a horrific attack. Disillusioned with the progress of the official investigation, he decides to take on the villains himself and heads for Colombia on a dangerous mission of revenge, determined to bring the perpetrators to justice. Action thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Francesca Neri, Elias Koteas and Cliff Curtis

programme.title: Exposed
programme.desc: A detective is determined to bring his dead partner's killers to justice, despite warnings from both his superior officers and the murdered man's wife to forget about it. As he delves deeper, he uncovers dangerous secrets and evidence of political corruption, with a devoutly religious woman seemingly the key to the mystery. Crime thriller, starring Keanu Reeves, Ana de Armas and Mira Sorvino

programme.title: Extraction
programme.desc: A veteran CIA agent is kidnapped by a terrorist organisation. His son, a government analyst turned down for field service, defies his superiors to mount his own rescue mission. He finds himself battling international assassins and top secret agents to save his father and prevent a terror attack. Action thriller, starring Kellan Lutz, Bruce Willis and Gina Carano

programme.title: Enemy of the State
programme.desc: A chance encounter with an old friend derails a successful lawyer's fast-track career, plunging him headlong into a deadly game of cat and mouse with relentless government agents capable of anticipating his every move. He quickly realises the only way to save his own life is to expose the truths his pursuers seem so intent on covering up, and seeks out a former intelligence agent to take them on at their own game. Thriller, starring Will Smith, Gene Hackman, Jon Voight and Lisa Bonet

programme.title: The Man from UNCLE
programme.desc: A CIA agent is forced into an uneasy alliance with his arch-rival in the KGB at the height of the Cold War. A criminal organisation is planning to alter the balance of power by making nuclear weapons widely available, and the two spies must work together to foil the plan. Action adventure based on the 1960s TV series, starring Henry Cavill, Armie Hammer, Alicia Vikander and Hugh Grant

programme.title: Phone Booth
programme.desc: A smart-mouthed PR executive answers a public phone and the caller on the other end warns him that if he hangs up he will be shot. The unseen gunman then puts his target through a tortuous series of mind games, as well as incriminating him in the death of a bystander. Psychological thriller, starring Colin Farrell, Kiefer Sutherland, Katie Holmes and Forest Whitaker

programme.title: Hanna
programme.desc: A former CIA agent raises his daughter alone in the wilderness of Finland, teaching her to be the world's deadliest assassin. When she turns 16, she is sent to carry out her one intended mission, but as she travels the world in search of her target, she is pursued by a CIA operative with a link to her mysterious past. Action thriller, with Saoirse Ronan, Cate Blanchett and Eric Bana

programme.title: The Hollow Point
programme.desc: A hard-drinking sheriff and his deputy are pitted against a sadistic cartel hitman. Crime thriller, starring Patrick Wilson, Ian McShane and John Leguizamo

programme.title: Follow
programme.desc: A young man gets a strange Christmas gift from his girlfriend, blacks out and then wakes up the next day to find his life crumbling around him. Horror, starring Noah Segan, Haley Lu Richardson and Don Most

programme.title: Mississippi Burning
programme.desc: Two mismatched FBI agents, one a tough former sheriff, the other a by-the-book idealist, are sent to a small town in the Deep South to investigate the disappearance of three civil rights activists, only to come up against a conspiracy of silence. Alan Parker's drama set in the 1960s, starring Gene Hackman, Willem Dafoe, Brad Dourif, Michael Rooker, R Lee Ermey and Frances McDormand

programme.title: Angel Flight Down
programme.desc: A mercy mission runs into difficulty when the plane commissioned to airlift a sick girl suffers engine trouble and crashes on the edge of a cliff. Drama, starring Patricia Kalember and David Charvet

programme.title: Kite
programme.desc: A teenager living in a corrupt society dominated by violent street gangs swears revenge when her parents are murdered. Joining forces with her father's former partner on the police force, she journeys into the depths of the criminal underworld to learn the killers' identities. Crime thriller, starring India Eisley and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: The Colony
programme.desc: A man travelling through Chile in the 1970s is abducted by the secret police during the military coup that brought Pinochet to power. His girlfriend tries to find out what has happened to him, but to uncover the truth, she must join a cult posing as a charitable organisation, from which no one has ever escaped. Drama, starring Emma Watson and Daniel Bruhl

programme.title: 12 Rounds 3: Lockdown
programme.desc: A cop returns to duty after being injured in an incident that led to the death of his partner. On his first day back, he discovers evidence of corruption among his colleagues. He soon finds himself trapped inside his own precinct and fighting for survival against crooked cops determined to keep their misdeeds a secret. Action thriller sequel, starring Jonathan Good and Roger R Cross

programme.title: Zodiac
programme.desc: Fact-based crime thriller about the tortuous hunt for a mysterious serial killer who terrorised San Francisco in the late 1960s and early 1970s, and taunted the police and media with cryptic messages. Three men became obsessed with identifying the murderer after his reign of terror inexplicably stopped, but their fixation with the case took a heavy toll on their lives. Starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Robert Downey Jr, Mark Ruffalo and Brian Cox

programme.title: Captive
programme.desc: A fugitive fleeing from a police manhunt is desperate to see his newborn son. Needing a hiding place, he takes a recovering meth addict hostage in her own home. The pair make an unlikely connection as they bond over finding ways to cope with the challenges in their lives. Fact-based drama, starring Kate Mara and David Oyelowo

programme.title: Breakdown
programme.desc: A stranded motorist is desperate when his wife disappears without a trace on a road trip - and the reluctance of the locals to help convinces him something sinister is going on. When it turns out that she has been abducted by a crazed trucker and his cronies, he is determined to set her free and make sure the villains pay for their crime. Thriller, starring Kurt Russell, Kathleen Quinlan, JT Walsh, MC Gainey, Jack Noseworthy and Rex Linn

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent is assigned to infiltrate a gang of daredevil extreme sports athletes, and prove that they are responsible for a string of audacious bank robberies. As he pushes himself to the limit to prove his worth to the group, he forms an intense relationship with their enigmatic leader. Action thriller remake, starring Edgar Ramirez, Luke Bracey and Ray Winstone

programme.title: Red Dragon
programme.desc: The FBI agent who first captured Hannibal Lecter is called out of retirement to catch a demented murderer dubbed the Tooth Fairy, who slaughters a family whenever there is a full moon - forcing the detective to draw on the imprisoned cannibal's expertise in criminal psychology. Thriller prequel adapted from the first of Thomas Harris's Lecter novels, starring Anthony Hopkins, Edward Norton, Ralph Fiennes and Philip Seymour Hoffman

programme.title: The Silence of the Lambs
programme.desc: Trainee FBI agent Clarice Starling is sent to interview an imprisoned psychopath with a taste for eating his victims. The inmate offers to help catch a serial killer who is holding a politician's daughter hostage - but to learn what he knows, Clarice has to engage in his dangerous mind games. Jonathan Demme's Oscar-winning thriller, based on Thomas Harris's novel, starring Jodie Foster, Anthony Hopkins, Scott Glenn and Ted Levine

programme.title: Undercover Hooligan
programme.desc: Suspended cop Michael Clarke is tasked with infiltrating an infamous London gang and bringing down its leader. British crime drama, starring Kris Johnson and Patrick Connolly(n)

programme.title: Deadly Sisters
programme.desc: Two sisters tire of their mother's alcoholism and a string of her abusive boyfriends, and plot to kill her. Thriller, starring Abigail Breslin, Georgie Henley and Mira Sorvino(n)

programme.title: Breakdown
programme.desc: A stranded motorist is desperate when his wife disappears without a trace on a road trip - and the reluctance of the locals to help convinces him something sinister is going on. When it turns out that she has been abducted by a crazed trucker and his cronies, he is determined to set her free and make sure the villains pay for their crime. Thriller, starring Kurt Russell, Kathleen Quinlan, JT Walsh, MC Gainey, Jack Noseworthy and Rex Linn(n)

programme.title: Point Last Seen
programme.desc: The head of a search and rescue team whose children were kidnapped by her ex-husband hunts obsessively for a girl gone missing in the desert. However, her search is interrupted by news that her spouse has been found - but the children he took are nowhere to be found. Fact-based drama, starring Linda Hamilton and Kevin Kilner(n)

programme.title: Dead Again
programme.desc: A private detective tries to solve the mystery surrounding a woman suffering from amnesia. With the aid of hypnosis, he discovers she is the reincarnation of a murder victim from the 1940s, and that history may be fated to repeat itself. Thriller, starring and directed by Kenneth Branagh. With Emma Thompson, Derek Jacobi, Andy Garcia and Robin Williams(n)

programme.title: The Prestige
programme.desc: Victorian stage illusionists Robert Angier and Alfred Borden engage in a bitter personal and professional rivalry. The pair resort to increasingly brutal measures to sabotage each other's acts, while Angier becomes obsessed with the secret behind Borden's greatest illusion. Christopher Nolan's mystery thriller, starring Hugh Jackman, Christian Bale, Michael Caine, Piper Perabo and Scarlett Johansson, with David Bowie as real-life scientific pioneer Nikola Tesla(n)

programme.title: Along Came a Spider
programme.desc: A police forensic psychologist searches for the daughter of a senator, who has been kidnapped from her expensive private school by a media-obsessed teacher, sparking a desperate race to hunt down her psychotic and devilishly intelligent captor before it is too late. Thriller prequel to Kiss the Girls, starring Morgan Freeman, Monica Potter, Michael Wincott, Dylan Baker and Penelope Ann Miller(n)

programme.title: Bad Boys II
programme.desc: Two mismatched undercover cops set out to halt an underground gang war and bring down a drug lord attempting to flood the market with a deadly form of Ecstasy. However, a romantic interlude threatens to drive the investigation off course. Comedy thriller sequel, starring Will Smith, Martin Lawrence, Gabrielle Union, Jordi Molla and Peter Stormare(n)

programme.title: Cruel Summer
programme.desc: An autistic teenager heads into the woods seeking some peace and quiet, unaware that three thugs with their own agendas are closing in on him. Drama, starring Danny Miller, Reece Douglas and Richard Pawulski(n)

programme.title: Fast & Furious
programme.desc: News of a friend's murder brings international fugitive Dominic Toretto back to his home city of Los Angeles in search of revenge. It is not long before his pursuit leads him to cross paths with FBI agent Brian O'Conner, and despite their hostile feelings toward each other, the pair work together to bring down those responsible. Thriller sequel, starring Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Michelle Rodriguez and Jordana Brewster(n)

programme.title: Along Came a Spider
programme.desc: A police forensic psychologist searches for the daughter of a senator, who has been kidnapped from her expensive private school by a media-obsessed teacher, sparking a desperate race to hunt down her psychotic and devilishly intelligent captor before it is too late. Thriller prequel to Kiss the Girls, starring Morgan Freeman, Monica Potter, Michael Wincott, Dylan Baker and Penelope Ann Miller(n)

programme.title: Bad Boys
programme.desc: Detectives Mike Lowrey and Marcus Burnett search for a $100million heroin consignment brazenly stolen by a French drug kingpin from the police evidence room. However, after a mix-up over a phone call from a potential witness, each cop has to assume the other's identity - Lowrey becoming the henpecked family man and Burnett the playboy. Michael Bay's action thriller, starring Will Smith, Martin Lawrence, Tea Leoni, Tcheky Karyo and Theresa Randle(n)

programme.title: Bad Boys II
programme.desc: Two mismatched undercover cops set out to halt an underground gang war and bring down a drug lord attempting to flood the market with a deadly form of Ecstasy. However, a romantic interlude threatens to drive the investigation off course. Comedy thriller sequel, starring Will Smith, Martin Lawrence, Gabrielle Union, Jordi Molla and Peter Stormare(n)

programme.title: End of Days
programme.desc: A world-weary former police officer encounters the Devil himself on New Year's Eve 1999, and is spurred into action to stop the Prince of Darkness exploiting an innocent woman to bring about Armageddon. Supernatural thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Gabriel Byrne, Robin Tunney, Rod Steiger, Kevin Pollak, CCH Pounder and Miriam Margolyes

programme.title: The Sixth Sense
programme.desc: A child psychologist, disheartened after the suicide of a former patient, takes on the case of a terrified boy haunted by ghostly apparitions, and tries to help him discover what the spirits want from him. M Night Shyamalan's supernatural thriller, starring Bruce Willis, Haley Joel Osment, Toni Collette and Olivia Williams

programme.title: War for the Planet of the Apes: Special
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the sci-fi action sequel, starring Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn

programme.title: Cell
programme.desc: A mysterious signal is transmitted to every mobile phone in the world, causing those who hear it to turn into bloodthirsty maniacs. A writer who was unaffected by the transmission bands together with a few other survivors to track down his family and unlock the mystery behind the crisis. Sci-fi thriller based on Stephen King's novel, starring John Cusack and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Stardust
programme.desc: A young shop assistant in Victorian England enters a magical parallel world in search of a fallen star to give to the girl of his dreams. However, the star has taken on the form of a beautiful woman, who he helps flee from a wicked witch and a murderous prince. Fantasy adventure, based on Neil Gaiman's novel, with Charlie Cox, Claire Danes, Michelle Pfeiffer, Robert De Niro, Mark Strong and Sienna Miller. Narrated by Ian McKellen

programme.title: Paranormal Activity: The Ghost Dimension
programme.desc: A man moves into a new house along with his wife, daughter and younger brother, and finds an old camcorder and a box of videotapes. The siblings start watching the tapes, which turn out to be home movies shot by the property's previous owners, but by doing so, they unleash evil spirits into the world. Horror sequel, starring Chris J Murray and Brit Shaw

programme.title: Morgan
programme.desc: A corporate risk-management consultant decides whether or not to destroy an artificially created humanoid. Sci-fi thriller, starring Kate Mara, Anya Taylor-Joy and Rose Leslie

programme.title: Johnny Frank Garrett's Last Word
programme.desc: A young man wrongly sentenced to death for the murder of a Catholic nun wreaks vengeance from beyond the grave. Supernatural horror-thriller, starring Sean Patrick Flanery, Erin Cummings and Mike Doyle

programme.title: Cell
programme.desc: A mysterious signal is transmitted to every mobile phone in the world, causing those who hear it to turn into bloodthirsty maniacs. A writer who was unaffected by the transmission bands together with a few other survivors to track down his family and unlock the mystery behind the crisis. Sci-fi thriller based on Stephen King's novel, starring John Cusack and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Johnny Frank Garrett's Last Word
programme.desc: A young man wrongly sentenced to death for the murder of a Catholic nun wreaks vengeance from beyond the grave. Supernatural horror-thriller, starring Sean Patrick Flanery, Erin Cummings and Mike Doyle

programme.title: 28 Days Later
programme.desc: A man wakes from a coma to discover Britain has been struck by a terrifying experimental virus that sends victims into a homicidal rage. With a handful of other survivors, he heads for Manchester, the last outpost unaffected by the outbreak - but realises the virus is not the only threat. Danny Boyle's horror, starring Cillian Murphy, Naomie Harris, Brendan Gleeson and Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: 28 Weeks Later
programme.desc: The US military oversees the repopulation of Britain after a virus that turned those infected into bloodthirsty killers finally dies out. Two children sneak away from a London safe zone and make a discovery that threatens to unleash the virus again. Juan Carlos Fresnadillo's horror sequel to 28 Days Later, with Robert Carlyle, Rose Byrne, Jeremy Renner, Imogen Poots and Idris Elba

programme.title: Project: ALF
programme.desc: A lovable alien is captured by the US army who plan to destroy him, prompting two officers to come to his aid. Spin-off from the sci-fi comedy TV series, with Miguel Ferrer, Ed Begley Jr and Martin Sheen

programme.title: Fantastic Four
programme.desc: A gifted young scientist joins a secret project researching inter-dimensional travel, and return from a journey to another world granted superhuman powers. Their abilities make them the only hope for Earth's survival when a colleague who was lost on their expedition returns to wreak vengeance. Superhero adventure, starring Miles Teller, Michael B Jordan, Kate Mara and Jamie Bell

programme.title: Friend Request
programme.desc: A teenager meets a girl online, only to find she is a demonic entity intent on killing her real friends. Horror, starring Alycia Debnam-Carey and William Moseley

programme.title: The Shallows
programme.desc: Medical student Nancy Adams' plan to honour her late mother puts her face to face with a massive, man-eating shark. Survival horror, starring Blake Lively and Oscar Jaenada

programme.title: Monster House
programme.desc: A boy becomes obsessed with a sinister elderly neighbour living in a creepy old house. On Halloween night, he and two friends discover the chilling truth - the house is alive and eats anything that comes too close, including children. Animated comedy horror, with the voices of Mitchel Musso, Sam Lerner, Spencer Locke, Steve Buscemi, Maggie Gyllenhaal and Jason Lee

programme.title: The Girl with All the Gifts
programme.desc: A scientist and a teacher living in a dystopian future embark on a journey of survival with a young girl named Melanie. Horror thriller, starring Gemma Arterton, Paddy Considine, Glenn Close and Sennia Nanua

programme.title: Fantastic Four
programme.desc: A gifted young scientist joins a secret project researching inter-dimensional travel, and return from a journey to another world granted superhuman powers. Superhero adventure, starring Miles Teller, Michael B Jordan, Kate Mara and Jamie Bell

programme.title: Lights Out
programme.desc: A troubled family discovers there is every reason to be afraid of the dark when they come face to face with an entity. Supernatural horror, starring Teresa Palmer, Gabriel Bateman and Maria Bello

programme.desc: Medical student Nancy Adams' plan to honour her late mother puts her face to face with a massive, man-eating shark. Survival horror, starring Blake Lively and Oscar Jaenada

programme.title: The Girl with All the Gifts
programme.desc: A scientist and a teacher living in a dystopian future embark on a journey of survival with a young girl named Melanie. Horror thriller, starring Gemma Arterton, Paddy Considine, Glenn Close and Sennia Nanua

programme.title: Hollow Man
programme.desc: A brilliant scientist tests an invisibility serum on himself, but becomes dangerously intoxicated by the power he acquires. He abandons his morals and heads out into the city to take full advantage of his condition. Realising he has been up to no good, concerned colleagues decide to confront him - with terrible consequences. Paul Verhoeven's sci-fi thriller, starring Kevin Bacon, Elisabeth Shue, Josh Brolin and Kim Dickens

programme.title: Lights Out
programme.desc: A troubled family discovers there is every reason to be afraid of the dark when they come face to face with an entity. Supernatural horror, starring Teresa Palmer, Gabriel Bateman and Maria Bello(n)

programme.title: Anna
programme.desc: A reporter travels to Singapore to investigate her sister's mysterious death, and enlists the aid of her brother-in-law in getting to the truth. She discovers a connection to a series of similar deaths, and faces a demonic entity that is using modern technology to complete an ancient mission. Horror, starring Elizabeth Rice and Matthew Settle(n)

programme.title: Monster House
programme.desc: A boy becomes obsessed with a sinister elderly neighbour living in a creepy old house. On Halloween night, he and two friends discover the chilling truth - the house is alive and eats anything that comes too close, including children. Animated comedy horror, with the voices of Mitchel Musso, Sam Lerner, Spencer Locke, Steve Buscemi, Maggie Gyllenhaal and Jason Lee(n)

programme.title: Let's Be Evil
programme.desc: Badly in need of money, a young woman takes a job supervising an advanced learning programme that quickly spirals out of control. Thriller, starring Kara Tointon, Jamie Bernadette and Isabelle Allen(n)

programme.title: Clash of the Titans
programme.desc: The son of the Greek god Zeus is raised by humans and grows up to reject his immortal heritage in anger at the gods' cruel treatment of humans. He sets out on a quest to find a means to kill the evil lord of the underworld in revenge for his father's death, facing all manner of strange creatures. Mythological adventure, with Sam Worthington, Liam Neeson, Ralph Fiennes and Gemma Arterton(n)

programme.title: The Dark Knight
programme.desc: In the sequel to Batman Begins, the masked hero finds a new ally in his war on organised crime in Gotham's crusading new district attorney, Harvey Dent. However, both men are pushed to their limits by the rise of the Joker, a criminal mastermind spreading chaos and destruction throughout the city for his own amusement. Comic-book thriller, starring Christian Bale, Aaron Eckhart and an Oscar-winning Heath Ledger(n)

programme.title: Suicide Squad
programme.desc: A ragtag team of gifted villains, including Deadshot, Harley Quinn and Killer Croc, are strong-armed into doing good by a no-nonsense government agent. Fantasy adventure, starring Will Smith, Margot Robbie and Jared Leto(n)

programme.title: Don't Breathe
programme.desc: A trio of thieves break into the house of a blind man who is not as helpless as he seems, and their hopes of walking away with a massive fortune do not go to plan. Horror, starring Stephen Lang, Jane Levy and Dylan Minnette(n)

programme.title: Clash of the Titans

He sets out on a quest to find a means to kill the evil lord of the underworld in revenge for his father's death, facing all manner of strange creatures. Mythological adventure, with Sam Worthington, Liam Neeson, Ralph Fiennes and Gemma Arterton(n)

Comic-book thriller, starring Christian Bale, Aaron Eckhart and an Oscar-winning Heath Ledger(n)

programme.title: Suicide Squad

programme.title: Don't Breathe
programme.desc: A trio of thieves break into the house of a blind man who is not as helpless as he seems, and their hopes of walking away with a massive fortune do not go to plan. Horror, starring Stephen Lang, Jane Levy and Dylan Minnette(n)

programme.title: Klute
programme.desc: A private detective investigates the disappearance of a scientist in New York, but finds his only lead is a prostitute with a tenuous connection to the missing man - and his attempts to gain her help are soon hampered by shadowy figures intent on silencing her. Alan J Pakula's thriller, starring Donald Sutherland, Roy Scheider and an Oscar-winning Jane Fonda

programme.title: Still the Water
programme.desc: Two teenagers fall in love while he is coming to terms with the divorce of his parents and she is coping with the imminent death of her mother. Coming-of-age drama, starring Nijiro Murakami, Jun Yoshinaga and Miyuki Matsuda

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview
programme.desc: Upcoming films

programme.title: Game On
programme.desc: A young street artist's plan to move to London is put on hold when her mother and grandmother face eviction. Musical, starring Kinga Preis, Eliza Rycembel, Stanislawa Celinska and Sebastian Fabijanski

programme.title: Valley of Love
programme.desc: An estranged couple meet for the first time in years in Death Valley, California, having responded to a message left for them by their dead son, who committed suicide six months previously. They are instructed to visit a series of locations in the desert, with the promise that their son's ghost will appear to them. Drama, starring Isabelle Huppert and Gerard Depardieu. In French and English

programme.title: God's Pocket
programme.desc: A construction worker believes his life will be simpler following the death of his troublemaking stepson. However, he finds things go from bad to worse as his relationship with his wife deteriorates and a reporter grows suspicious about the tragedy. Drama based on Peter Dexter's novel, starring Philip Seymour Hoffman, Christina Hendricks and John Turturro

programme.title: Girls Lost
programme.desc: Three bullied teenage schoolgirls drink the nectar of a mysterious plant growing in one of their gardens and are turned into boys. Swedish fantasy drama, starring Mandus Berg, Adam Dahlgren and Malin Eriksson

programme.title: How Green Was My Valley
programme.desc: Residents of a Welsh mining community at the start of the 20th century struggle to come to terms with the decline in their traditional way of life. Oscar-winning drama, starring Walter Pidgeon, Maureen O'Hara, Donald Crisp and Roddy McDowall

programme.title: Things to Come
programme.desc: A high-school philosophy teacher is forced to re-examine her life when her husband leaves her for another woman. Drama, starring Isabelle Huppert, Andre Marcon and Roman Kolinka. In French, German and English

programme.title: The Childhood of a Leader
programme.desc: Ignored by his distant, disciplinarian parents, youngster Prescott develops into an ego-driven brat whose behaviour becomes increasingly unsettling. Psychological drama, starring Berenice Bejo, Liam Cunningham, Stacy Martin and Tom Sweet

programme.title: The Hunt for Red October
programme.desc: A Soviet submarine commander creates an international crisis by piloting his experimental nuclear vessel, which is invisible to sonar, toward the American coast. The US and Russian navies think he is planning to attack and set out to destroy the submarine, but a CIA analyst suspects he intends to defect to the West. Cold War thriller, based on Tom Clancy's novel, starring Sean Connery, Alec Baldwin and James Earl Jones

programme.title: The Brand New Testament
programme.desc: God secretly lives in Brussels, spending his time enacting spiteful punishments on the human race. His rebellious daughter tries to teach him a lesson by sending everyone on Earth a message containing the date of their death. As the world is plunged into chaos, she flees from her furious father - who gains a new insight into his creation. Comedy, starring Pili Groyne, Benoit Poelvoorde and Catherine Deneuve. In French and German

programme.title: The Gambler
programme.desc: A professor of literature becomes addicted to gambling, leaving him in serious debt to a brutal loan shark and forcing him to take yet more desperate risks to escape his problem. Drama, starring James Caan, Lauren Hutton and Paul Sorvino

programme.title: The Survivalist
programme.desc: A loner survives the downfall of civilisation, living in a remote cabin on a small plot of land. When two women discover his refuge, he grudgingly allows them food and shelter, but they struggle to trust one another, especially as the supplies begin to run out. Thriller, starring Martin McCann and Mia Goth

programme.title: Colt 45
programme.desc: Vincent, a young police firearms expert, is forced to make use of his skills as a marksman when he is ambushed by an unknown assailant. Left with a killing to cover up, Vincent turns to a fellow gun enthusiast with ties to the criminal underworld offers to help him dispose of the evidence. In exchange, he hands over a small arsenal of weapons - including a set of home-made, explosive .45 ammo, but when said guns are used in a string of deadly robberies, Vincent must turn to seasoned police commander Chavez to help correct his fatal error of judgement. French action thriller, starring Ymanol Perset, Joey Starr and Gerard Lanvin

programme.title: Like Father, Like Son
programme.desc: A hard-working family man discovers that his six-year-old son was accidentally mixed up with another baby at birth. As he considers how to resolve the situation, the devotion of his wife and the other family involved to the children they have raised makes him wonder if he has been a good father. Drama, starring Masaharu Fukuyama and Machiko Ono. In Japanese

programme.title: Bluebird
programme.desc: During a freezing cold winter in the frozen woods of an isolated Maine logging town, a lapse of concentration has devastating consequences for a school bus driver. Drama, starring Amy Morton, John Slattery and Louisa Krause

programme.title: The Measure of a Man
programme.desc: An unemployed man struggles to support his wife and son on meagre state benefits, while contending with pointless and humiliating bureaucracy as she searches for a job. He is eventually employed as a firm's head of security, only to discover his new position confronts him with a terrible moral dilemma. Drama, starring Vincent Lindon and Karine de Mirbeck. In French

programme.title: Hyena Road
programme.desc: Adept Canadian sharpshooter Ryan Sanders and his unit are forced to take refuge with an village elder while on the run from Taliban fanatics in Afghanistan. Resigned to their fate, the soldiers anxiously wait for the old man to betray them to his countrymen, but instead he saves their lives, then disappears without a trace. When Sanders reports this unusual turn of events on his return to Kandahar, seasoned intelligence officer Pete Mitchell is convinced the sniper has happened upon the legendary Afghan freedom fighter known as the Ghost, and enlists Sanders' aid in tracking the man down once again to assist in the war effort. Military drama, starring Rossif Sutherland and director Paul Gross

programme.title: The Here After
programme.desc: A teenager is released from a young offenders' institution and returns to his family home. He is forced to endure a life of silent misery as his past crimes inspire bullying from his schoolfriends, while their suspicious parents take steps to drive him from the community altogether. His only solace comes in a friendship with a girl who is fascinated by his dark past. Drama, starring Ulrik Munther and Mats Blomgren. In Swedish

programme.title: Champion
programme.desc: A war veteran criss-crosses America with his disabled brother in tow as he builds a new career as a renowned prizefighter. However, his ruthless determination to make it to the top drives him to betray the people closest to him. Drama, starring Kirk Douglas, Marilyn Maxwell, Arthur Kennedy, Paul Stewart and Ruth Roman

programme.title: The White Ribbon
programme.desc: A village in Germany is plagued by strange events in the months leading up to the First World War, as a series of accidents leads on to mysterious acts of vandalism and people being attacked by unknown assailants. As the villagers try to cope with their bad fortune, secrets start to come to light. Michael Haneke's Palme d'Or-winning mystery, starring Christian Friedel and Leonie Benesch. In German, Italian and Polish

programme.title: The Birds
programme.desc: A San Francisco socialite takes a shine to a man she meets by chance, and follows him home to a Californian coastal community. Her arrival coincides with a series of mysterious attacks on people by birds, which soon escalates as vast flocks go on the warpath. Alfred Hitchcock's thriller, based on a Daphne du Maurier short story, starring Tippi Hedren, Rod Taylor, Suzanne Pleshette, Jessica Tandy and Veronica Cartwright

programme.title: Nocturnal Animals
programme.desc: An art gallery owner is tormented by the violent thriller penned by ex-husband. Tom Ford's psychological thriller, starring Amy Adams, Jake Gyllenhaal and Michael Shannon

programme.title: The Thin Red Line
programme.desc: The personal stories of American soldiers sent to fight on the Pacific island of Guadalcanal during the Second World War. The men, among them a former deserter, are forced to confront their fears and beliefs during a bitter conflict for control of a key airfield. Terrence Malick's Second World War drama, adapted from James Jones' 1962 novel. Starring Sean Penn, Ben Chaplin, Nick Nolte, Jim Caviezel and Woody Harrelson

programme.title: Black
programme.desc: Mavela, a 15-year-old in Brussels gang The Black Bronx, must choose between love and loyalty when she falls for Marwan, a Moroccan boy from rival group the 1080s. Drama, starring Martha Canga Antonio, Aboubakr Bensaihi and Sanaa Alaoui(n)

programme.title: Tiger Raid
programme.desc: While on a covert mission, two cold-blooded mercenaries form an unlikely bond as they race across the desert in the dead of night. Action thriller, starring Damien Molony and Sofia Boutella(n)

programme.title: The Fencer
programme.desc: A champion fencer fleeing from the Soviet secret service inspires Estonian schoolchildren to take up the sport. Drama, starring Mart Avandi and Ursula Ratasepp(n)

programme.title: Across the Line
programme.desc: A black ice hockey player's dream of going pro are threatened by racial tensions in his Nova Scotia community. Canadian sports drama, starring Stephan James and Sarah Jeffery(n)

programme.title: The Wonders
programme.desc: The lives of a family of bee keepers living in isolation in central Italy are disturbed by the arrival of a troubled teenage boy, who has been taken on as a farmhand, and a television production crew. Against her father's wishes, Gelsomina enters the family onto a reality TV show about traditional Italian food. Drama, starring Alba Rohrwacher. In Italian(n)

programme.title: Reds
programme.desc: Oscar-winning fact-based drama, based on the life of American journalist and activist John Reed, famous for his first-hand account of the 1917 Russian Revolution. The film focuses on his relationship with writer Louise Bryant, whom he first encounters at a meeting for radical thinkers. Leaving her husband, she joins Reed on his journey to Russia as the Bolshevik uprising gets under way. Directed by and starring Warren Beatty. With Diane Keaton, Jack Nicholson and Edward Herrmann(n)

programme.title: My Internship In Canada
programme.desc: An independent MP from rural Quebec unexpectedly finds himself holding the tie-breaking vote on whether Canada should go to war. Political comedy, starring Patrick Huard, Irdens Exantus and Suzanne Clement(n)

programme.title: Barbarella
programme.desc: A futuristic space heroine embarks on a series of bizarre sexual misadventures as she searches a strange planet for an evil scientist threatening galactic peace. Surreal sci-fi adventure, starring Jane Fonda, John Phillip Law, Anita Pallenberg, Milo O'Shea and David Hemmings(n)

programme.title: Maggie's Plan
programme.desc: A young New Yorker's plan to have a kid on her own is derailed when she falls for a married man. Romantic comedy, starring Greta Gerwig, Ethan Hawke and Bill Hader(n)

programme.title: Julieta
programme.desc: A chance encounter with a childhood friend of her estranged daughter causes a guilt-ridden Madrid woman to rethink her future. Pedro Almodovar drama, starring Emma Suarez and Adriana Ugarte(n)

programme.title: Moneyball
programme.desc: The manager of a struggling baseball team faces disaster, as his star players are bought out by richer clubs and he is unable to afford to replace them. An economics student offers him a solution to his problems, finding a ground-breaking way to analyse the performance of cheaper players and combining their abilities to form a winning side. Fact-based drama, starring Brad Pitt, Jonah Hill and Philip Seymour Hoffman(n)

programme.title: Babel
programme.desc: An American couple visit Morocco, but when one of them is accidentally shot, an international crisis ensues. Their Mexican maid, who was left to look after the children back home, encounters difficulty recrossing the border following her son's wedding, while in Tokyo, a deaf mute girl, whose father has a connection to the man responsible for the shooting, struggles to cope with her mother's suicide. Drama, starring Brad Pitt, Cate Blanchett and Gael Garcia Bernal(n)

programme.title: Zero Dark Thirty
programme.desc: A CIA operative joins a team of intelligence and military operatives in the aftermath of the September 11 attacks. She spends the next 10 years searching for information on the whereabouts of Osama bin Laden, ultimately leading to the final raid on the terrorist leader's hideout. Kathryn Bigelow's fact-based drama, starring Jessica Chastain and Mark Strong

programme.title: The Tale of the Princess Kaguya
programme.desc: An elderly bamboo cutter finds a tiny princess in a glowing shoot, little realising she will grow up to be a beautiful, strong-willed woman. After receiving several marriage proposals, she sets her suitors a variety of challenges in an attempt to learn which of them deserves to win her heart. Animated fantasy, featuring the voices of Chloe Grace Moretz, James Caan and Mary Steenburgen

programme.title: Stuart Little
programme.desc: An American couple decide their son needs a brother, and plan to adopt another child - but when they get to the orphanage they are greeted by a charming talking mouse named Stuart, who fits the bill perfectly. However, their jealous cat hatches a plot to get rid of the new arrival. Comedy adventure, starring Geena Davis and Hugh Laurie, with the voice of Michael J Fox

programme.title: The House of Magic
programme.desc: A stray cat wanders into a magician's mansion, and finds it is full of strange gadgets. The illusionist allows him to stay, to the annoyance of his other pets, but the cat proves an invaluable addition to the group when their owner's scheming nephew plots to take the house for himself. Animated adventure, with the voices of Murray Blue and Doug Stone

programme.title: Chalet Girl
programme.desc: A 19-year-old skateboarding champion gives up the sport as she struggles to support herself and her father. She gets a job working in a ski resort, where she feels out of her comfort zone in high society, but she finds a way to put her old skills to good use by competing in a prestigious snowboarding competition. Comedy, with Felicity Jones, Ed Westwick and Bill Nighy

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada
programme.desc: A woman with dreams of becoming a journalist takes a job as assistant to the editor of a prestigious fashion magazine - a position that should guarantee a bright future if she succeeds. Unfortunately, she has just signed up to work for the boss from hell, whose cruel personality and outrageous demands make her life a nightmare. Comedy drama, with Meryl Streep, Anne Hathaway, Stanley Tucci and Emily Blunt

programme.title: Dracula Untold
programme.desc: A Romanian knight fights to defend his homeland against Turkish invaders. Faced with overwhelming odds, he enters into a dangerous bargain to gain supernatural powers so he can drive off his enemies - but the deal could cost him his humanity as he transforms into a terrifying monster. Fantasy adventure, starring Luke Evans, Dominic Cooper and Charles Dance

programme.title: I, Frankenstein
programme.desc: The infamous scientist's monster roams the Earth 200 years after burying his creator, and is drawn into an ancient supernatural conflict. Two factions of magical beings are at war, and the key to ending the conflict lies in tapping the secret of the creature's immortality. Fantasy adventure, starring Aaron Eckhart, Bill Nighy and Miranda Otto

programme.title: Season of the Witch
programme.desc: Two disillusioned Crusaders return home to find the land devastated by the Black Death. A cardinal persuades them to escort a suspected witch to a monastery to stand trial for causing the plague, but during their journey, they realise she has supernatural powers beyond their reckoning. Fantasy adventure, starring Nicolas Cage and Ron Perlman

programme.title: Silent Running
programme.desc: A scientist, with the help of his three robot assistants, tends a huge garden aboard a space station, created to replenish an Earth ravaged by nuclear warfare. But his superiors' decision to abandon the project prompts him to embark on a desperate course of action. Ecological sci-fi drama, starring Bruce Dern, with Cliff Potts and Ron Rifkin

programme.title: When Marnie Was There
programme.desc: Premiere. Anne is sent by her adoptive parents to spend the summer with a couple who live near a tidal marsh, where she meets Marnie, an enigmatic child her own age living in an apparently abandoned mansion. The two form a passionate friendship and Anna is drawn into Marnie's dream-like world and tries to solve the mystery of her past. Animated drama from Studio Ghibli, with the voices of Hailee Steinfeld and Kiernan Shipka

programme.title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid
programme.desc: A boy starts a new school determined to be popular and admired, only to find himself instead a target for bullies. He documents his experiences in a journal as he sets out on a series of attempts to gain the respect he feels he deserves - but his every effort ends in disaster. Family comedy, with Zachary Gordon, Robert Capron and Chloe Grace Moretz

programme.title: Ice Age: Dawn of the Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Sid the sloth discovers three eggs - but when they hatch into dinosaurs, he struggles to keep them under control. The creatures' mother comes looking for her offspring and takes them and Sid to an underground world where the giant reptiles never became extinct. Sid's friends, aided by a crazed one-eyed weasel, head for this strange new land to rescue him. Animated adventure sequel, with the voices of John Leguizamo, Denis Leary, Ray Romano and Simon Pegg

programme.title: Starman
programme.desc: An alien who crash-lands on Earth falls in love with a widow after assuming her dead husband's identity as a cover, but the duo are soon fleeing the authorities in a frantic effort to reach an extraterrestrial rescue ship. Sci-fi fantasy romance, directed by John Carpenter and starring Jeff Bridges, Karen Allen, Charles Martin Smith, Richard Jaeckel and Robert Phalen

programme.title: Knight and Day
programme.desc: A woman has a chance encounter with a rogue secret agent, who has been framed as a traitor and is on the run from his own superiors. Realising she is in danger for knowing too much, he kidnaps her and drags her along on his desperate mission to clear his name. Comedy adventure, with Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz

programme.title: The Wolverine
programme.desc: The former member of the X-Men is lured out of hiding and travels to Japan, where a dying businessman offers him the chance to give up his immortality for a normal life. He ends up robbed of his superhuman powers by a mysterious scientist and is forced to protect the tycoon's granddaughter from a secret conspiracy's assassins. Superhero adventure spin-off, starring Hugh Jackman and Tao Okamoto

programme.title: Dog Soldiers
programme.desc: A run-of-the-mill training exercise turns into a bloodbath for soldiers on weekend manoeuvres in the Highlands. After rescuing the lone survivor of a massacred special forces unit, they are set upon by a pack of werewolves. Taking cover in an abandoned farmhouse, they are besieged by the creatures and face a battle to survive until morning. British horror, starring Kevin McKidd, Sean Pertwee, Emma Cleasby and Liam Cunningham

programme.title: The French Connection
programme.desc: Two tough New York cops use unorthodox methods to try to break an international drug ring. When their information leads them to place a candy store under surveillance, they discover the owners are the American agents for a French kingpin planning to ship millions of dollars worth of heroin into the US. Oscar-winning fact-based thriller, starring Gene Hackman, Roy Scheider, Fernando Rey and Tony Lo Bianco(n)

programme.title: Epic
programme.desc: A teenager wanders into a forest that her scientist father believes is home to a race of miniature people. She stumbles on the tiny creatures and is shrunk down to their size so she can carry out a quest to save their new queen from an invading army. Animated adventure, with the voices of Amanda Seyfried, Josh Hutcherson, Colin Farrell and Christoph Waltz(n)

programme.title: Stuart Little 2
programme.desc: The plucky talking mouse feels left out when the son of his adopted human family makes a new pal - but quickly forgets such trifling matters when his high-flying canary friend is captured by an evil falcon, prompting the brave rodent to mount a daring rescue. Family adventure sequel, with Geena Davis, Hugh Laurie and Jonathan Lipnicki, and the voices of Michael J Fox, Melanie Griffith and James Woods(n)

programme.title: Magic in the Water
programme.desc: Two children investigate the legend of a mythical creature rumoured to live in the lake by their holiday home. They are astonished when they discover the monster and find it is actually quite friendly - and is eager to help the children thwart a company dumping toxic waste in the water. Family adventure, starring Mark Harmon, Joshua Jackson and Harley Jane Kozak(n)

programme.title: Rio 2
programme.desc: Parrots Jewel and Blu lead a happy life together in Rio with their three chicks, until they find themselves hurled into an expedition up the Amazon. The journey leads to an encounter with an old enemy, while Blu also has to win the approval of Jewel's fearsome father. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Jesse Eisenberg, Anne Hathaway and Jamie Foxx(n)

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse
programme.desc: Bella Swan's confused feelings for vampire Edward and werewolf Jacob threaten to ignite a conflict between the two supernatural races. Meanwhile, a series of murders heralds the return of an old enemy, who has raised an army to aid her quest for revenge. Third part of the romantic fantasy series, with Kristen Stewart, Robert Pattinson, Taylor Lautner and Bryce Dallas Howard(n)

programme.title: Alien Resurrection
programme.desc: Scientists create a clone of Ripley to get hold of the alien queen growing inside her body and breed a new race of the monsters. However, when the creatures escape and turn on their makers, the new Ripley must lead a smuggling crew caught up in the mayhem to safety. Sci-fi thriller sequel, starring Sigourney Weaver, Winona Ryder and Ron Perlman(n)

programme.title: AVP: Alien vs Predator
programme.desc: A team of scientists investigates the discovery of a mysterious pyramid beneath the Antarctic ice, which is inhabited by a deadly alien race. Meanwhile, a second species of hostile extraterrestrials are on their way to prove their worth by vanquishing the first in battle - with the unfortunate humans caught in the middle. Sci-fi thriller, starring Sanaa Lathan, Raoul Bova and Lance Henriksen(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Mary Ellen goes on a date, but faces a troublesome dilemma between making a good impression and telling the truth

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy defends a freshman football player whom he previously accused of cheating, and Ben discovers the dangers of smoking

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Laura's decision to accept a temporary teaching job in a nearby town prompts Almanzo to realise she's not a child any more - forcing him to finally confront his feelings for her. Drama, starring Melissa Gilbert and Dean Butler

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: He Loves Me, He Loves Me Not - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The death of Adam's father jeopardises plans to build a new school for the blind in Walnut Grove. Almanzo proposes to Laura, but she is heartbroken when Charles forbids them to marry until she is 18. Drama, starring Melissa Gilbert, Michael Landon and Dean Butler

programme.title: A Son's Promise
programme.desc: A 15-year-old boy promises his dying mother that he will look after his six younger brothers and keep them together as a family. Drama, starring Ricky Schroder, David Andrews and Veronica Cartwright

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Mark and Jonathan work as hotel bellhops to help a millionaire's son dubbed Rudd the Dud find meaning in his life. They must also contend with a tyrannical boss and snooty guests

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark spend Christmas trying to show a crooked car salesman the error of his ways

programme.title: The Thorn Birds: The Missing Years
programme.desc: Part two of a sequel to the blockbuster TV drama, exploring the period of history skipped over in the original series, following the cross-continental escapades of a wartime priest (Richard Chamberlain), his illicit lover (Amanda Donohoe), and her brutish husband. While raising her family in the Australian Outback, the wayward wife dabbles in deceit to keep the truth about the priest's illegitimate child from her husband. Also starring Simon Westaway, Julia Blake and Olivia Burnette

programme.title: Judith Krantz's Till We Meet Again
programme.desc: Part two of three. Freddie and Jock join forces in the fruit flying business, while Bruno could soon be tasting his just desserts. Drama, starring Michael York and Lucy Gutteridge

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The family offers the new minister a place to stay, and Elizabeth falls in love with him. Erin offers to help the Baldwin sisters write their memoirs

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Caroline convinces herself she is going to have another baby, but Doc Baker tells her she is clutching at straws and will never have any more children. To cheer her up, Charles arranges for them to renew their wedding vows. Drama, starring Michael Landon

programme.title: The War Bride
programme.desc: A cockney seamstress marries a Canadian serviceman after a whirlwind romance in London during the Second World War. She is sent to live with his family on their farm in a backwater of Alberta until the conflict is over, but she struggles to get along with her dour in-laws, who make no attempt to welcome her. Drama, starring Anna Friel, Brenda Fricker, Molly Parker, Loren Dean and Aden Young

programme.title: The Disappearing Act
programme.desc: A distraught mother turns detective to find out the truth behind her son's disappearance, concerned he may have met with foul play at the hands of his beautiful but volatile girlfriend. Fact-based drama, starring Patty Duke, Kelly Rowan and Robert Floyd

programme.title: Beauty and the Beast
programme.desc: Part two of two. Concluding the fantasy drama, starring Alessandro Preziosi, Blanca Suarez, Giusy Buscemi and Lea Bosco

programme.title: Promises to Keep
programme.desc: An old man learns he has a terminal illness, and decides he needs to rebuild his relationship with the family he abandoned 30 years ago. However, his son finds it difficult to forgive him for leaving them. Drama, starring Robert Mitchum with his real-life son Christopher and great-nephew Bentley. With Tess Harper and Claire Bloom

programme.title: A Killer in the Family
programme.desc: A killer manages to con his three sons into helping him and his cellmate escape from prison - a move which lands them in the middle of a murder spree. Thriller based on a true story, starring Robert Mitchum, James Spader and Eric Stoltz

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The arrival of a sophisticated family from New York has unenviable consequences for the Waltons

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy disobeys his mother and enters a week-long dance marathon with a pretty girl from a neighbouring town

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: He Loves Me, He Loves Me Not - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Laura buries herself in her work at the blind school in an attempt to get over the pain of her lost love - but is unexpectedly reunited with Alamanzo

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part one of two. Laura announces her marriage to Almanzo, but the path ahead is strewn with financial difficulty. Drama, starring Melissa Gilbert

programme.title: The Disappearing Act
programme.desc: A distraught mother turns detective to find out the truth behind her son's disappearance, concerned he may have met with foul play at the hands of his beautiful but volatile girlfriend. Fact-based drama, starring Patty Duke, Kelly Rowan and Robert Floyd

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan helps Mark to find an old friend who has been missing for five days, but finds nobody is willing to talk about him

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan falls in love with a woman he is trying to matchmake with another man, and Mark tries to persuade him to put his own happiness first for a change

programme.title: The Man Who Made Husbands Jealous
programme.desc: Part one of two. Adaptation of Jilly Cooper's novel about Lysander Hawkley, a philanderer whose best friend edges him into a new line of work - patching up ailing marriages. Stephen Billington stars, with Kim Criswell and Hugh Bonneville

programme.title: Judith Krantz's Till We Meet Again
programme.desc: Part three of three. The war is over and the de Lancel's have seen their share of tragedy. Drama, starring Michael York and Lucy Gutteridge

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jason wrestles with the morality of war as he decides whether to enlist in the army, while Jim Bob is desperate to join up despite being too young

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part one of two. Charles and Albert go on a delivery run and meet the Cooper family. Whilst tackling a steep hill, Alvin loses control of his wagon leading to a tragic accident. Charles later sends two children to live in a distant orphanage, but then begins to have doubts about what he's done

programme.title: William and Catherine: A Royal Romance
programme.desc: A dramatised account of the courtship of Prince William and his St Andrews sweetheart Catherine Middleton. Picking up the story at a pivotal moment in their romance, the film follows William as he heeds advice from his mother, the late Princess Diana, which she bestowed in an interview before her death in 1997. Drama, starring Dan Amboyer and Alice St Clair

programme.title: The Children Nobody Wanted
programme.desc: A man saddened by the plight of orphaned children resolves to do all he can to relieve their suffering, so sets out to become the first unmarried foster parent in America. Fact-based drama, starring Michelle Pfeiffer, Frederic Lehne, Noble Willingham and Matt Clark

programme.title: Cinderella
programme.desc: Modern version of the fairytale set in post-war Rome, about a girl with a gift for music forced to work as a maid in her stepmother's hotel. With Rosabell Laurenti Sellers and Frank Crudele

programme.title: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: A soon-to-be separated couple embark on a cross-country road trip to attend their son's wedding, a journey which takes them on an emotional roller-coaster revisiting their past, family and friends. Romantic comedy, starring Richard Dreyfuss, Judy Davis and Selma Blair

programme.title: Convoy
programme.desc: A renegade trucker clashes with a redneck sheriff and the authorities in general as he leads a mammoth convoy across America. Sam Pekinpah's road movie inspired by the song by CW McCall, starring Kris Kristofferson, Ali MacGraw, Ernest Borgnine, Burt Young and Madge Sinclair

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy's book is accepted for publishing, ensuring his feelings of inadequacy are completely erased, and upstaging his brother Jason in the process(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy's new part-time job hurtles him into the throes of an emotional battle raging in the heart of a hostile young blind woman(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part two of two. Laura returns Almanzo's ring but his sister Eliza comes up with a cunning rescue plan. Drama, starring Melissa Gilbert(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Trying to start a new life after Alice's death, Jonathan and his son Andy move to Sleepy Eye to establish a freight business(n)

programme.title: The Children Nobody Wanted
programme.desc: A man saddened by the plight of orphaned children resolves to do all he can to relieve their suffering, so sets out to become the first unmarried foster parent in America. Fact-based drama, starring Michelle Pfeiffer, Frederic Lehne, Noble Willingham and Matt Clark(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: God grants Mark the chance to go back in time and tell his now deceased grandfather that he loved him(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan comes to the aid of an illiterate basketball player whose career has been cut short by ill health, and helps him learn to read so he can secure a future outside the sport(n)

programme.title: The Man Who Made Husbands Jealous
programme.desc: Part two of two. Adaptation of Jilly Cooper's novel about Lysander Hawkley, a philanderer whose best friend edges him into a new line of work - patching up ailing marriages. Stephen Billington stars, with Kim Criswell and Hugh Bonneville(n)

programme.title: Hollywood Wives: The New Generation
programme.desc: A Hollywood star becomes convinced her husband is cheating on her, so hires a private eye to discover the truth. Meanwhile, a director's wife has an affair with an aspiring writer and a soul singer tries to form a closer relationship with her daughter. Drama, based on Jackie Collins' novel, starring Farrah Fawcett, Robin Givens and Melissa Gilbert(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Ben hatches a money-making scheme his father does not approve of, while Yancy trains to become a barber(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part two of two. Cassandra and James run away from their new adoptive father, who's so indifferent to their welfare that he doesn't even bother to look for them. Fortunately, they eventually end up back at the Ingalls household, where Charles comes up with a solution to their plight(n)

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: A former Cornish military captain, now a member of Parliament, is drawn into the war with France while his son falls in with smugglers. Historical drama, based on Winston Graham's novels, starring John Bowe and Mel Martin, and featuring a young Ioan Gruffudd in one of his earliest roles(n)

programme.title: Ride to Freedom: The Rosa Parks Story
programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling the life of Rosa Parks, the black woman who famously refused to give up her seat on a bus to a white man in 1950s America. The action prompted a massive outpouring of anger and sparked the rise of the civil rights movement. Angela Bassett, Cicely Tyson and Peter Francis James star(n)

programme.title: Cinderella
programme.desc: Modern version of the fairytale set in post-war Rome, about a girl with a gift for music forced to work as a maid in her stepmother's hotel. With Rosabell Laurenti Sellers and Frank Crudele(n)

programme.title: The Great Debaters
programme.desc: A politically radical professor at an all-black college from the Deep South in the racially segregated 1930s organises his students into a successful debate team. He leads them through a historic run of victories in the face of prejudice, leading to a contest with Harvard University's national champions. Fact-based drama, directed by and starring Denzel Washington. With Forest Whitaker(n)

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A taxi driver is found murdered in his cab outside a jeweller's, leading Burke and Fraser to investigate the shop's owner and his family, who deny all knowledge of the deceased. Meanwhile, Ross and Reid discover a link between the dead man and a powerful underworld figure, and suspicion begins to fall on a shady lawyer with political ambitions. Blythe Duff and John Michie star(n)

programme.title: MASH
programme.desc: The atmosphere is frantic as casualties flood into the station during the last days of the war, while Hawkeye is temporarily institutionalised due to a nervous breakdown. Feature-length finale of the comedy, starring Alan Alda, Mike Farrell and Loretta Swit
